evaluations.text: For which questions do we need causality? For instance, clinical research may find biomarkers that indicate a disease state but are not part of the causal chain or about which we have little mechanistic insight. Yet, they may be suitable to predict disease trajectories or treatment response.
evaluations.summary: The paragraph discusses the necessity of causality in clinical research, particularly regarding biomarkers.
